annotation: Mouth, cutting edge of a blade or weapon (Fbg)
(2) wʰan 'hole', nep ''bottom side of the face'

language: East Sumbanese, Umbu Ratu Nggai dialect

annotation: (1-1c) either Malay loan or chance, BB.

language: Kadazan Dusun of Taginambur, Kota Belud, Sabah, Malaysia

annotation: teeth, tooth, mouth, beak, point, needle
trivial or for animal mouth, come from pe(ic) which is the orifice, and trivially the human mouth
f<e>fa is the 3SG form; fafa- is the root form for other person-numbers
